lines.text: We're not going to be sad. We're going to be angry till we die.
how we judge those that hurt us and show no remorse.
Don't make me feel sorry for myself. The more pissed off I am, the better I feel.
It was Rose who dropped things through the grates. It was Rose who sang.
You can't have children, but you, Rose, your children will laugh when you die.

[referring to her mastectomy]
You think a breast weighs a pound?
You don't want it, my girl, you're out. Simple as that.

[voice over]
There was no use telling him that Caroline hadn't turned him down. She'd just expressed a doubt. She'd spoken as a lawyer, when she should've spoken as a daughter. But my father's pride had been injured.
You think this is bad, Daddy? You'd be amazed at what you really deserve. As far as I'm concerned, you're on your own now.
I don't remember you like this.
No. You looked on the good side of things. You were pretty and funny.
I was a ninny. I was a simpleton.
All I have is that I saw. That I saw without being afraid and without turning away. And that I didn't forgive the unforgivable.
Remorse reminds me of Daddy, who had none.
